means: （通常指不愉快的事）即将发生的

sentence.Network_en: A sense of imminent doom was inescapable.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种即将来临的毁灭感无可逃避。

sentence.Network_en: The black clouds show that a storm is imminent.
sentence.Network_cn: 乌云预示暴风雨即将来临.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语中读音相近的词_百度文库 ... eminent 杰出的 imminent 逼近的 except 除外.

immersed tube tunnel 沉管隧道imminent danger 迫切危险impact 冲击
法院支持她向Winchester提出的索赔要求,因为被告的过失致使“人命处于迫在眉睫的紧急危险(imminent danger)之中”,而在Winter bottom案中则不存在类似的危险。这与.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin imminent- 'overhanging, impending', from the verb imminere, from in- 'upon, towards' + minere 'to project'

entry.tran: (尤指不愉快的事)临近的，即将发生的，逼近的
entry.def: If you say that something is imminent, especially something unpleasant, you mean it is almost certain to happen very soon.

example.ex: They warned that an attack is imminent.
example.tran: 他们警告袭击即将发生。

means.word_mean: 1. close in time; about to occur;

sentences.sentence: "some people believe the day of judgment is close at hand"

auth_sentence.content: The clear-cut result has eased fears of imminent turmoil.
auth_sentence.res_content: The clear-cut result has eased fears of imminent turmoil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The clear-cut result has eased fears of imminent turmoil.

auth_sentence.content: His supporters said his return to Bahrain was imminent.
auth_sentence.res_content: His supporters said his return to Bahrain was imminent.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His supporters said his return to Bahrain was imminent.

auth_sentence.content: Few expect to see any imminent change of heart.
auth_sentence.res_content: Few expect to see any imminent change of heart.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Few expect to see any imminent change of heart.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+min伸出,突出+ent……的→adj.显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的
im进入+min伸出,突出+ent……的→伸进来的→即将发生的
pro向前+min伸+ent……的→向前伸出→杰出的
pre前+eminent突出的→向前突出的→杰出的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 用草写小字写的, 极小的
stems_affixes.word_buile: min小+uscule表形容词或名词→小的→极小的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 卓越的, 极为出色的
stems_affixes.word_buile: super过度,极度+eminent[adj.显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的]→adj.卓越的, 极为出色的
min小+or→adj.较小的,较小的 n.兼修学科 v.[in]兼修
minute微小的+ial表形容词→小事件→琐事
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ute→n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的
e出+min伸出,突出+ence表名词→n.卓越,杰出
pro向前+min伸+ence表名词→向前伸出→杰出
minute[[n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的]]→n.菜单

means.word_mean: (通常指不愉快的事)即将发生的, 逼近的，临近的

sentences.en: The black clounds show that a storm is imminent.
sentences.cn: 乌云预示暴风雨即将来临。

jushi.english: There does not seem to be an imminent danger of famine on a world scale.
jushi.chinese: 眼下似乎不存在大规模发生饥荒的危险。

jushi.english: They were advising clients to hedge the imminent inflation by buying farmland.
jushi.chinese: 他们曾建议顾客购买农田，以免遭受迫在眉睫的通货膨胀带来的损失。
